alert.note: Alert for Chesapeake; Norfolk, Portsmouth; Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 17 at 7:24PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of , the southeastern City of Norfolk, the City of Chesapeake, the southern City of Portsmouth and the City of Virginia Beach through 815 PM EDT... At 724 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Deep Creek, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Downtown Portsmouth around 730 PM EDT. Great Bridge and Norfolk State University around 735 PM EDT. Regent University and Fentress around 740 PM EDT. Kempsville and Virginia Wesleyan University around 745 PM EDT. Princess Anne around 750 PM EDT. Virginia Beach around 800 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include South Norfolk, Rudee Heights, Portlock, Mount Pleasant, Princess Anne Plaza, Sigma, Sandbridge Beach, Herberts Corner, Oceana NAS and Macons Corner. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
